definition: two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: The day the second child was born, their migrant-worker days were over.
sentences.chinese: 从生老二那天起，两口子的打工生活就结束了。

sentences.english: Second aunt couple are Medical, division-level cadres after the treatment of retirement.
sentences.chinese: 二姨两口子都是军医，后以师级干部待遇退休。

sentences.english: Since then, the pair have avoided the media.
sentences.chinese: 从那以后，两口子一直回避着新闻媒体。

sentences.english: The pair, from Sydney, Australia, have conquered some of the world's highest peaks.
sentences.chinese: 两口子来自澳洲悉尼，已经征服了不少世界高峰。

sentences.english: A husband and his wife had a bitter quarrel on the day of their 40th wedding anniversary.
sentences.chinese: 有两口子，在结婚40周年纪念日那天大吵一架。

sentences.english: I am is, sister-in-law's couple was all also affectionate, forgot this gift sons.
sentences.chinese: 我当是，弟妹两口子太过恩爱，把这礼儿都忘了。

sentences.english: The couple I heard this from are a Western husband-Chinese wife pair themselves.
sentences.chinese: 告诉我这个事儿的那两口子也是外国丈夫中国妻。

sentences.english: The couple dwelt together in harmony and concord.
sentences.chinese: 两口子和睦融洽地住在一起。

sentences.english: People began to nudge the couple into going away.
sentences.chinese: 人们开始劝说这两口子走开。

sentences.english: They are as happy a couple as I've ever seen.
sentences.chinese: 他们是我见过的最幸福的两口子。

sentences.english: The two of them, and their three-year-old child, would be moving in with Margie.
sentences.chinese: 女儿两口子和他们三岁的孩子都得搬到玛吉家了。

definition: erhua variant of 小兩口|小两口[xiao3 liang3 kou3]
daughter-in-law/wife (of a younger man)/young married woman/young woman
two (colloquial equivalent of 兩個|两个)/both/some
parents of one's daughter-in-law or son-in-law/relatives by marriage
